cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest toward the southeastern U.S. coast (Carolinas) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina or northern South Carolina

weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina through North Carolina coasts; hazardous surf up and down the U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (gusts 25-35 mph) in squalls late Thursday into early Friday; tropical-storm-force winds remain a low (<10%) chance
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the St. Johns River or Jacksonville waterfront given present track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1â€“2 inches; localized heavier downpours possible but widespread 4-inch totals not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the northeast Florida beaches beginning mid-week
